name: Your.MD
description:
At Your.MD, we believe everyone should have the information they need to look after their health. Five years ago, we brought together doctors, data-scientists and digital experts to create a new type of health app. One where anyone in the world could find personalised, medically-approved guidance, tools and support to help them feel better and stay healthy.

Millions of downloads later, we’re the first app approved as a medical device (class 1), on our way to our goal: helping one billion people find their health.

Backed by philanthropists and major corporations, our team is now 80-strong and growing, as we find new ways to bring informed self-care to all, especially in the era of coronavirus.

team.title: Insights & Operations Manager
team.name: Darryl Hubble
team.bioHtml: Tech-savvy self starter, dedicated, creative & passionate about start-ups.

jobs.title: Digital Marketing Executive - Paid Media
jobs.description:
At Your.MD, we believe everyone should have the information they need to look after their health. Five years ago, we brought together doctors, data-scientists and digital experts to create a new type of health app. One where anyone in the world could find personalised, medically-approved guidance, tools and support to help them feel better and stay healthy.

Millions of downloads later, we’re the first app approved as a medical device (class 1), on our way to our goal: helping one billion people find their health.

Backed by philanthropists and major corporations, our team is now 80-strong and growing, as we find new ways to bring informed self-care to all, especially in the era of coronavirus.

**Role**
This is a role that is perfect for a 2nd job profile, you would have 1 to 4 years experience with digital marketing optimisation, paid search, salary range £35K to £40K.

* Funnel/website optimisation and/or outbound channels like SEO, ASO, SEM, and email,
* Build, monitor and optimise paid campaigns across multiple channels such as Facebook & Google to drive user acquisition
* Work closely with the content team and leverage insight from paid campaigns to influence organic acquisition and strategy
* Help scale acquisition through our web channels via SEO optimisation and other organic growth techniques, optimising conversion funnels to maximise growth
* Drive ASO on both Google Play and App Store, working closely in liaison with product and marketing teams
* Support the ideation and execution of the product and content roadmap that helps drive growth, working with the Product, Tech, Marketing and Content teams
* Define and analyse metrics that inform the success of growth initiatives

**Requirements**
* 1 to 4 years level experience with digital marketing optimisation i.e. funnel/website optimisation and/or outbound channels like SEO, ASO, SEM, and email
* Proven experience within Paid Search / or Paid Social role, from a startup, corporate or agency.
* Experience using analytics tools such as Google Analytics
* Knowledge of A/B testing principles and tools such as Google Optimize
* Experience in making analytical, data-driven decisions and communicating the results of analyses
* Experience delivering growth in KPI's for technology or healthcare products with a positive ROI
* Creative problem solver: no-one has built what we are building, so you’ll need a genuine enthusiasm for healthcare/apps with an ability to keep finding solutions
* Must have a passion for the startup sector.

We like people who are:

* Caring and empathetic. We want to bring the best health information to everyone. We can’t do it if our team is not caring. Caring means caring about others, your team members, the work you do, and the impact of what you do on other people
* Forward-thinking: we want to work with forward-thinking people.

**Benefits**
* £35,000 to £40,000 salary
* Participate in the burgeoning digital health industry
* Work at the forefront of artificial intelligence (AI) development
* Work with an ambitious and dynamic team who support and learn from one another
* The opportunity for personal and professional development in an open environment where ideas and opinions are encouraged
* A remuneration package including stock options, gym contribution, and other benefits
* We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company.

jobs.title: Head of Data - Healthtech AI
jobs.description:
At Your.MD, we believe everyone should have the information they need to look after their health. Five years ago, we brought together doctors, data-scientists and digital experts to create a new type of health app. One where anyone in the world could find personalised, medically-approved guidance, tools and support to help them feel better and stay healthy.

Millions of downloads later, we’re the first app approved as a medical device (class 1), on our way to our goal: helping one billion people find their health.

Backed by philanthropists and major corporations, our team is now 80-strong and growing, as we find new ways to bring informed self-care to all, especially in the era of coronavirus.

**The role**

In a new period of growth, Your.MD is looking for an experienced Head of Data, that will structure and document a Data roadmap that helps the function monitor and deliver against its key objectives. Working cross-functionally with product, marketing, operations and clinical teams to understand what drives their business and make sound business decisions.

The new Head of Data will play a fundamental role in further underpinning our position in the market by providing actionable insights to the business with the wealth of data at its disposal.

Working with the Leadership Team to design, deliver and support the implementation of our data capability, responsible for:

* The definition and ownership of the overall data strategy
* The supervision of the data engineering team, build a team of 5
* The extraction of insights to support each department in the company, build a team of BA insights
* This is a fantastic opportunity for an experienced Head of Data to gain broad experience in a rapidly growing digital healthcare business.

**Requirements**
* Manage, execute and report analytical projects from start to finish including data gathering and manipulation, synthesis and modeling, problem solving, and communication of insights and clear recommendations to senior management
* Develop strong capability to implement data led thinking into all aspects of the organisation.
* Take accountability for Your.MD Data strategy and designing and developing solutions within that space accordingly.
* Providing a data warehouse that delivers 99% of service to business consumers at agreed KPIs
* Supporting other business functions to enable them to maximise the effectiveness of data and for Your.MD to become a 100% data driven organisation.
* Develop key business KPIs to underpin Data Governance.
* Delivering new technology enabled business capability – Predictive analytics - which will then lead to Artificial Intelligence.
Knowledge & Experience

* A degree or equivalent in a relevant quantitative discipline (Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering, Finance, Economics)
* A Head of Data who is both good with pure data and CRM data.
* Have a strong track record of data organisation, design, build and control of team and capability.
* Possess a demonstrable track record of using machine learning to deliver significant business benefits
* Be able to develop scope on an on-going basis and take advantage of emerging opportunities to change direction if necessary
* Be an inspiring leader – managing and mentoring a team of data experts. With a demonstrable track record of leading similar functions
* Be able to monetize data opportunities and to drive these to deliverable value
* Have demonstrable full lifecycle experience with a background in B2B, B2C
* Have awareness of data frameworks, compliance etc
* Proven analytical and quantitative skills and an ability to use hard data and metrics to back up assumptions and develop business cases
* Advanced hands-on knowledge and experience of data manipulation using SQL, preferably in BIgQuery
* Experience with data visualisation tools, preferably using Tableau and Amplitude

**Benefits**
* An exceptional opportunity to participate in the burgeoning digital health industry aiming to positively impact large numbers of people around the world – both where the wait to see a doctor is too long, or those with poor or no healthcare
* Work at the forefront of artificial intelligence (AI) development
* A competitive remuneration package including stock options, flexible working, gym subscription, and other benefits
* We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. We are currently around 50% female / male and our staff come from 18 different countries.

skills: Data Mining, Statistical Data Analysis and Data Modeling

jobs.title: Health Writer - Healthtech AI
jobs.description:
At Your.MD, we believe everyone should have the information they need to look after their health. Five years ago, we brought together doctors, data-scientists and digital experts to create a new type of health app. One where anyone in the world could find personalised, medically-approved guidance, tools and support to help them feel better and stay healthy.

Millions of downloads later, we’re the first app approved as a medical device (class 1), on our way to our goal: helping one billion people find their health.

Backed by philanthropists and major corporations, our team is now 80-strong and growing, as we find new ways to bring informed self-care to all, especially in the era of coronavirus.

Your.MD is now looking for an accomplished mid-to-senior level health writer to join its ambitious team.

This newly-created role will be responsible for writing medically-accurate digital copy for the company’s editorial and marketing channels (blog, health advice library, Android & iOS apps and social media).

**Requirements**
This is a full-time in-house role based in London, UK. You will need to have the right to work in the UK to be considered for this role.

If you join us, you’ll get to:
* Produce medically-accurate and SEO-friendly editorial content (articles, blogs and general copy) for our app, website and social media channels
* Work closely with our in-house medical team to regularly craft new and informative health articles and condition summary cards
* Dissect medical guidance and information and repurpose into easy to understand copy for a global audience, where English may not be the first language
* Proofread all copy and messaging, ensuring that it adheres to brand and quality guidelines
* Source appropriate imagery to accompany copy and disseminate content in a timely manner on the website and via key social media channels
* Work as part of a dynamic team and carve your own space within a fluid working environment

**Essential requirements**
This is a mid-to-senior level role for a writer with at least 3 years of experience writing for an online health or medical publication. As such, you must have:

* Excellent command of the English language - you should be obsessed with spelling and grammar but you also embrace new ways of using the language
* 3-5 years’ proven experience in a health writer role for an online publication or website
* Advanced degree in English, journalism (including NCTJ qualification), life sciences, or any healthcare-related field
* A good understanding of health/medical concepts and conditions

Bonus:
* Creative versatility to produce a wide range of copy, from UX microcopy to email newsletters, blog posts and corporate messaging
* An understanding of UI/UX and experience working with product designers and developers
* Curiosity fuels your creativity: you enjoy figuring out how/what in your copy works or doesn’t and use that to craft even better messages
* Proficient in Microsoft Word, Excel and Powerpoint

**Benefits**
Compensation You’ll receive a competitive salary with monthly contribution to health & wellbeing activity of your choice and stock options.

You will get to work with an ambitious, highly talented and very friendly team in our Central London office.

Compensation You’ll receive a competitive salary with monthly contribution to health & wellbeing activity of your choice and stock options.

You will get to work with an ambitious, highly talented and very friendly team in our Central London office.

jobs.title: Marketing Manager
jobs.description:
At Your.MD, we believe everyone should have the information they need to look after their health. Five years ago, we brought together doctors, data-scientists and digital experts to create a new type of health app. One where anyone in the world could find personalised, medically-approved guidance, tools and support to help them feel better and stay healthy.

Millions of downloads later, we’re the first app approved as a medical device (class 1), on our way to our goal: helping one billion people find their health.

Backed by philanthropists and major corporations, our team is now 80-strong and growing, as we find new ways to bring informed self-care to all, especially in the era of coronavirus.

The Marketing Manager will manage user communications across channels including in-app, email, and push. This role will own and build out the communication channels for Your.MD owned and operated channels. Working across functionally with Marketing, PR, Product, Growth & Business Development, Partnerships, Medical, Creative and more to produce and execute best in class engagement strategies.

**Responsibilities

**User Engagement / Lifecycle Management**
* Conceptualize and build out plans to achieve best in class engagement across the all aspects of the user journey
* Build hierarchy of messages and optimum platform for delivery (email, push, in-app)
* Set up A/B tests that provide consistent learning on top performing channels, messaging, and offers by buyer stage to optimize campaigns
* Own and manage Airship / Mailchimp platforms, in partnership with Product team - strategy through to execution and optimisation of campaigns
* Utilize agile and creative approaches and test cases to overcome obstacles in the user journey and better understand our customers
* Act as a conduit to product for engagement drop-off / in-app

**Creative Development**
* Be proactive in identifying messaging opportunities
* Develop briefs for emails / notifications and source through creative (copy and design) to produce on-brand outputs
* Manage end-to-end journey incorporating feedback / sign off from key stakeholders
* Coordinate corporate resources, track deliverables, prioritize and escalate issues
* Influencers & Social Media
* Work together with Social Media Agency and Head of Content to ensure alignment of marketing campaigns across social channels
* Be aware of the market and identify like minded individuals to integrate into campaigns

**Reports & Insights**
* Be proactive in planning and publish calendar overviews to showcase upcoming campaign plans and against key performance metrics / key changes based on learnings
* Partner with Insights & Analytics team to provide clear and concise reports on engagement and performance against goals, as well as the customer experience and feedback

**General**
* Undertake additional and or other responsibilities to meet business requirements, and gain exposure to all elements of Communications.
* Requirements
* 2- 5 years in Marketing / User Engagement role (good to have cross-channel experience - where channels included both push and email)
* Passion for the startup sector.
* Excellent verbal & written communication skills.

**Benefits**
* Participate in the burgeoning digital health industry
* Work at the forefront of artificial intelligence (AI) development
* Work with an ambitious and dynamic team who support and learn from one another
* The opportunity for personal and professional development in an open environment where ideas and opinions are encouraged
* A remuneration package including stock options, gym contribution, office snacks and other benefits
* We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company.

jobs.title: Website Project Manager
jobs.description:
At Your.MD, we believe everyone should have the information they need to look after their health. Five years ago, we brought together doctors, data-scientists and digital experts to create a new type of health app. One where anyone in the world could find personalised, medically-approved guidance, tools and support to help them feel better and stay healthy.

Millions of downloads later, we’re the first app approved as a medical device (class 1), on our way to our goal: helping one billion people find their health.

Backed by philanthropists and major corporations, our team is now 80-strong and growing, as we find new ways to bring informed self-care to all, especially in the era of coronavirus.

**Role**

This is a role that is perfect for a 2nd job profile, you would have 1 to 4 years experience managing digital products. Ideally a website or web application, using tools such as Trello, Jira and Google Analytics. Salary range £35K to £40K.

Reporting directly into Digital Marketing you will work alongside our QA and Javascript teams to manage and deliver features and you will liaise closely with our marketing, content, analytics, and product team to help create and optimise the backlog.

**Requirements**
* Own the website, managing priorities and all related tasks such as ticket raising and updates and coordination of development resource
* Own the coordination and delivery of specific growth projects, working cross-functionally with the tech, medical, design, content and marketing teams
* Ensure a strong understanding of the goals and KPIs the growth team is striving to achieve to ensure that priorities for the web site and special projects are anchored to our commercial objectives
* Work closely with the product team to develop a deep understanding of current and future customer needs, to question user behaviour, and analyse data to find answers and opportunities
* Develop a good understanding of competitive products in our space.
* Support the ideation of the product and content roadmap to help drive growth
* Support the growth of multilingual content by project managing internal and external translators
* Work closely with the content team and use data to inform content strategy

**Experience**
* 1 to 4 years experience managing digital products, ideally a website or web application, Experience using both task and backlog management tools such as Trello and Jira and web analytics tools such as Google Analytics
* Understanding and experience of agile ways of working. Comfortable working within an agile and entrepreneurial environment
* Experience thinking strategically, structurally solving product problems, and ensuring strong delivery working side by side with colleagues from the development team
* Creative problem solver: no-one has built what we are building, so you’ll need genuine enthusiasm for healthcare with an ability to keep finding solutions
* Experience of progressive web applications is a plus
* We like people who are: Caring and empathetic. We want to bring the best health information to everyone. We can’t do it if our team is not caring. Caring means caring about others, your team members, the work you do, and the impact of what you do on other people, Forward-thinking: we want to work with forward-thinking people.

**Benefits**
* Salary range £35K to £40K.
* Participate in the burgeoning digital health industry
* Work at the forefront of artificial intelligence (AI) development
* The opportunity for personal and professional development in an open environment where ideas and opinions are encouraged
* A remuneration package including stock options, gym contribution, and other benefits

  • We like people who are: Caring and empathetic. We want to bring the best health information to everyone. We can’t do it if our team is not caring. Caring means caring about others, your team members, the work you do, and the impact of what you do on other people, Forward-thinking: we want to work with forward-thinking people.

Benefits

  • Salary range £35K to £40K.
  • Participate in the burgeoning digital health industry
  • Work at the forefront of artificial intelligence (AI) development
  • The opportunity for personal and professional development in an open environment where ideas and opinions are encouraged
  • A remuneration package including stock options, gym contribution, and other benefits
skills: Web and Mobile Application Development and Marketing.
